verbose_text: The study of HtpB functions, which are not seemingly shared by other Group 1 chaperonins, promises to increase our general understanding of chaperonin biology and the evolution of intracellular pathogens that have adapted to the human host by using an ancient protein tool.
evidence: HtpB functions, which are not seemingly shared by other Group 1 chaperonins, promises to increase our general understanding of chaperonin
